main event: Unidentified flying objects were reported by American G2 office personnel and Taiwanese pilots over Taiwan in the 1950s and 1960s.
interesting points: The American G2 office in Taiwan observed 5 bright lights moving in zig-zag patterns at a constant speed in 1952.
Taiwanese pilots reported seeing a large, cylindrical, silver-colored object that was approximately 30 meters long in 1960. It traveled at extremely high speeds and made sharp turns.
When the Taiwanese pilots attempted to intercept the object, it accelerated and disappeared.
The object was reported to be larger than the pilots' aircraft.
The reports include details about the objects' movement, size, shape, and color, as well as the duration of the sightings.
witnesses: American G2 office personnel, Taiwanese pilots
